dashboard.description: Uploaded by andrewn at Thu  9 Jul 2020 11:39:52 UTC

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions within a minute period. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better

targets.expr:
clamp_max(
  max by (type) (max_over_time(gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="nfs"}[$__interval]))
  or
  sum by (type) (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{environment="$environment",monitor!~"global|",stage="$stage",type="nfs"}),
  1
)

clamp_max(
  avg by (type) (avg_over_time(gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="nfs"}[$__interval])),
  1
)

(6 * avg(slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{type="nfs"}))
or
avg(slo:max:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{type="nfs"})

(14.4 * avg(slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{type="nfs"}))
or
(2 * avg(slo:max:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{type="nfs"}))

max by (type) (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="nfs"} offset 1w)
or
sum by (type) (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{environment="$environment",monitor!~"global|",stage="$stage",type="nfs"} offset 1w)

panels.title: Error Ratios

targets.expr:
sum (
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="nfs"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="nfs"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="nfs"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="nfs"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="nfs"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_30m{environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="nfs"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="nfs"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_6h{environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="nfs"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="nfs"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.

targets.expr:
avg by (type)
(avg_over_time(gitlab_service_ops:rate_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="nfs"}[$__interval]) or avg_over_time(gitlab_service_ops:rate{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="nfs"}[$__interval]))
or
sum by (type) (gitlab_service_ops:rate_5m{environment="$environment",monitor!~"global|",stage="$stage",type="nfs"} or gitlab_service_ops:rate{environment="$environment",monitor!~"global|",stage="$stage",type="nfs"})

avg by (type) (
  gitlab_service_ops:rate_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="nfs"} offset 1w
  or
  gitlab_service_ops:rate{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="nfs"} offset 1w
)
or
sum by (type) (
  gitlab_service_ops:rate_5m{environment="$environment",monitor!~"global|",stage="$stage",type="nfs"} offset 1w
  or
  gitlab_service_ops:rate{environment="$environment",monitor!~"global|",stage="$stage",type="nfs"} offset 1w
)

panels.title: RPS - Service Requests per Second

panels.description: Saturation is a measure of what ratio of a finite resource is currently being utilized. Lower is better.
panels.title: Saturation

panels.description: The total number of jobs in the system queued up to be executed. Lower is better.

targets.expr: sum by (type, shard, export) (rate(node_mountstats_nfs_total_read_bytes_total{environment="$environment"}[$__interval]))

panels.title: Total NFS read throughput per service-shard

panels.description: The total number of jobs in the system queued up to be executed. Lower is better.

targets.expr: sum by (type, shard, export) (rate(node_mountstats_nfs_total_write_bytes_total{environment="$environment"}[$__interval]))

panels.title: Total NFS writes throughput per service-shard

panels.description: Lists saturated resources that are breaching their soft SLO thresholds at this instant

styles.linkTooltip: Click the link to review the past 1 day(s) history for this saturation point.
Click the link to find issues on GitLab.com related to this saturation point.

targets.expr:
(
  max by (type, stage, component) (
  clamp_max(
    gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment", type="nfs", stage=~"|$stage"}
    ,
    1
  ) >= on(component, monitor, env, cluster) group_left slo:max:soft:gitlab_component_saturation:ratio
)

)
* on(component) group_left(alert_dashboard, severity)
(
  absent(fake_dne{component="cgroup_memory", alert_dashboard="sat_cgroup_memory", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="cpu", alert_dashboard="sat_cpu", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_space", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_space", severity="s2"})

panels.title: Currently Saturated Resources

panels.description: Lists saturated resources that, given their current value and weekly variance, have a high probability of breaching their soft thresholds limits within the next few hours

styles.linkTooltip: Click the link to review the past 7 day(s) history for this saturation point.
Click the link to find issues on GitLab.com related to this saturation point.

targets.expr:
(
  sort_desc(
  max by (type, stage, component) (
    clamp_max(
      gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:avg_over_time_1w{
        environment="$environment",
        type="nfs", stage=~"|$stage"
      } +
      2 *
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:stddev_over_time_1w{
          environment="$environment",
          type="nfs", stage=~"|$stage"
        }
      , 1
    )
    >= on(component, monitor, env, cluster) group_left slo:max:soft:gitlab_component_saturation:ratio
  )
)

)
* on(component) group_left(alert_dashboard, severity)
(
  absent(fake_dne{component="cgroup_memory", alert_dashboard="sat_cgroup_memory", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="cpu", alert_dashboard="sat_cpu", severity="s3"})
or

panels.title: Resources Currently at Risk of being Saturated

panels.description: Lists saturated resources that, given their growth rate over the the past week, and their weekly variance, are likely to breach their soft thresholds limits in the next 14d

styles.linkTooltip: Click the link to review the past 30 day(s) history for this saturation point.
Click the link to find issues on GitLab.com related to this saturation point.

targets.expr:
(
  sort_desc(
  max by (type, stage, component) (
    clamp_max(
      gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:predict_linear_2w{
        environment="$environment",
        type="nfs", stage=~"|$stage"
      } +
      2 *
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:stddev_over_time_1w{
          environment="$environment",
          type="nfs", stage=~"|$stage"
        }
    , 1
    )
    >= on(component, monitor, env, cluster) group_left slo:max:soft:gitlab_component_saturation:ratio
  )
)

)
* on(component) group_left(alert_dashboard, severity)
(
  absent(fake_dne{component="cgroup_memory", alert_dashboard="sat_cgroup_memory", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="cpu", alert_dashboard="sat_cpu", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_space", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_space", severity="s2"})
or

panels.title: Resources Forecasted to be at Risk of Saturation in 14d

panels.description: Resource saturation levels for saturation components for this service. Lower is better.
panels.title: Long-term Resource Saturation

panels.description: Percentage of time that resource is within capacity SLOs. Higher is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:avg_over_time_1w{
        type="nfs",
        environment="$environment",
        stage=~"$stage|"
      }
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: Long-term Resource Saturation - Rolling 1w average trend

panels.content:
graph TD
  subgraph stor
  nfs
end

targets.expr:
clamp_max(
  max by (type) (max_over_time(gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage"}[$__interval]))
  or
  sum by (type) (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{environment="$environment",monitor!~"global|",stage="$stage"}),
  1
)

panels.title: System Diagram (Keyed by Error Rates)

panels.content:
graph TD
  subgraph stor
  nfs
end

targets.expr:
min by (type) (min_over_time(gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage"}[$__range]))
or
min by (type) (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{environment="$environment",monitor!~"global|",stage="$stage"})

panels.title: Source

dashboard.title: nfs: Overview
